key_title: Key to the species of Lavatera

source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Lavatera
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1996). Lavatera. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Epicalyx remaining shorter than calyx, not much enlarged in fruit; flowers pale, bluish, pink or white; spreading to erect shrubs, but rarely exceeding 1.5 m
Epicalyx exceeding calyx, enlarging further and spreading in fruit; flowers bright magenta to purple; ± erect shrub to c. 3 m high, chiefly coastal
Petals 10–18 mm long; epicalyx at least two-thirds as long as calyx at anthesis; mericarps smooth dorsally, adjacent angles usually rounded
Petals 15–30 mm long; epicalyx less than two-thirds as long as calyx at anthesis; mericarps reticulate, adjacent angles acute, sometimes narrowly winged, usually dentate
